SYSTEM: OWL.pdf: PÃ¡gina 29
Web Ontology Language
OWL semantics
For example, we can state (In our ontology!) that in order to be 
human something must eat plants
Eating plants is a necessary condition to be human: all the 
humans eat plants, but there are other organisms that also 
eat plants that are not humans
We can also define a necessary and sufficient condition: 
producing language is a unique quality of humans: if we find 
an individual (Organism) capable of producing language we 
can infer that is human, since no other organism does it
speaker: SYSTEM
